content: Some notes I take when I learn Marine Science data analysis methods.
title: Data Analysis

content:
1. Introduction Supposed we need one property data to study on problem, and we measure that property in the field, recorded as p(x), where x is the coordinates of that property, which can be spatial coordinates or temporal coordinates. In the realy world, we can’t make sure that those p are regularlly measured. However, many data analysis methods needs the data to be regularly recorded, or to be gridded. Therefore, we need to calculate the estimated p(x’) in the gridded location x’ based on the measured p(x), those steps call Interpolation.
2. Cases 2.1 3D SSH/Altimeter data interpolation. What we have: mesured level 3 track altimeter SSH data, recorded as {SSH(lon, lat, time)}. Those data are scatter data.
Steps   Weighting data $SSH(lon_i,lat_j, t_1) $to $SSH(lon_i, lat_j, t_0)$ $$ W_{k}=\frac{2-\frac{\Delta t^{2}}{T^{2}}}{2+\frac{\Delta t^{2}}{T^{2}}} $$ this equation is from Zhang et al.(2006), where $\Delta t = t_1-t_0$
  interpolating those data with the 2D interpolating methods at time $t_0$. For example, Kriging interpolation, optimal interpolation or barnes interpolation.
  References  Zhang, H., Bates, J. J., &amp; Reynolds, R. W. (2006). Assessment of composite global sampling: Sea surface wind speed. Geophysical Research Letters, 33, L17714. https://doi.org/10.1029/2006GL027086
title: Data Interpolation 数据插值

content:
Ref: Lee et al 2020 Environ. Res. Lett. in press https://doi.org/10.1088/1748-9326/ab8527
1. What data did the author use in this paper?   Satellite observation: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Optimum Interpolation (OI) SST data (OISST; Reynolds et al 2002),
1982~2018, $0.25^o\times0.25^o$, daily.
Variable : SST
  Model data: NASA Modern-Era Retrospective Analysis for Research and Application Version 2 (MERRA2; Gelaro et al 2017)
$0.5^o\times 0.625^o$, 72 levels from surface to 0.01 hPa
Variable: geopotential height fields.
  Global Precipitation Climatology Project (GPCP) data
Variable: Precipitation
  2. What methods did the author use?  EOF Linear Regression  3. what are their most important findings or conclusions (up to 3)? 4. what do you find most interesting about their research? 5. would you have done the research differently, to improve it, if it was you doing it? 6. Results:   figure 1.
 Mean SST warming can explain most of the MHW duration increasing. (c) explains (d) (c): increasing trend is not significant everywhere.  Figure 1. Seasonal mean of (a) SST and (b) 90th percentile of daily SST using OISST data for 1982‒2011, and long-term trends of (c) seasonal mean and (d) total MHW duration days for 1982‒2018. (e) Time series of total MHW duration (solid line) with a least-square linear fit (dashed line). The dashed regions in (c) and (d) indicate the area where the trends of SST and MHWs are significant with confidence level.
 (e): exihibut a strong interannual variation as well as a positive rend.    Figure 2.
Figure 2. Spatial patterns of the two primary modes of the EOF of East Asian MHW duration in the left
panels ((a) and (b)) and the associated PC time series of two principal components in the right panels
((c) and (d)).
 Mode 1: basin mode mode 2: dipole mode    Figure 3: a wamer begin is good for MHW development

(a,b,c,d): annual mean, (e,f,g,h): linear trend
 in the South China Sea, where the higher‐value area is closer to the lower‐latitude direction. The high annual mean total days in the northern South China Sea mainly result from the high frequency of MHWs, while those in the Bohai Sea result from a longer duration    Figure 3

Zelun Wu Ph.D. student of Physical Oceanography, Xiamen University &amp; University of Delaware zelunwu@stu.xmu.edu.cn, zelunwu@udel.edu
Research Interests Climate Change, Marine Heatwaves

description: calling custom Shortcodes into your content files.
title: Table of Contents

content:
由于我使用的是Mac，所以这里的教程针对macOS和Linux，Windows不适用（cmd我也不熟），应该也是类似，直接去官网下载Hugo的exe文件安装即可（应该，没试过）。
1. 下载Hugo到本地 homebrew 是mac上类似debian的 apt和centos/redhat 的 yum的软件管理平台，很多开源软件以及编译环境，apt/yum能完成的，homebrew多数情况下也能完成， 比如netcdf/gcc等。
首先安装打开homebrew, 已经装好的可以跳过，打开terminal输入：
/bin/bash -c &quot;$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install.sh)&quot; 安装完成后安装hugo:
brew install hugo 2. Hugo 创建本地博客 原理是这样：你在content文件夹里面写博客（markdown），Hugo根据自有的文件框架，自动生成一个public文件夹，文件夹里面是多数服务器能识别的html文件。如果需要部署到服务器或者githubpage，将public文件夹同步上就行。
先cd到你想要放本地博客的文件夹，用hugo创建博客文件夹并初始化：
hugo new site myblog myblog可以是任意你想要的名字。然后需要下载主题themes，上这里去挑：https://themes.gohugo.io，挑完进主题的github仓库里面，下载到 myblog/themes文件夹，或者用git克隆下来。比如我看上了一个很简约的主题：hugo-theme-techdoc，就是这个博客用的，那么我的命令是：
cd myblog cd themes git clone https://github.com/thingsym/hugo-theme-techdoc.git cd .. 完成后就可以看看你本地的博客了：
hugo server -t hugo-theme-techdoc 浏览器输入：http://localhost:1313
3. 写博客 创建主页：terminal输入
hugo new content/_index.md 或者直接进 content 文件夹创建 _index.md文件也行。用markdown输入你想要展示的主页内容即可。
创建 about： 同样，在content文件夹里面创建about.md
笔记归类： 在content里面创建文件夹，然后这个文件夹里面单独创建_index.md文件，用于描述该分类，文件头应有类似描述：
+++ title: 教程 date: 2020-06-22T15:26:15Z draft: false weight: 11 +++ 其中weight表示这个分类在目录的排序，1 就是排在第一个。
文件图片管理： hugo的图片文件都放在 mysite/static文件夹，markdown引用一个figure.png的文件，将这个文件拷贝进static文件夹，然后任意markdown文件引用的的时候直接
![figure](figure.png) 即可。但是这样有个问题，网页端可以显示，但是本地编辑器类似typora不能显示。解决方案是将要写的文件命名为文件夹，写入的markdown文件在文件夹里面命名成_index.md,然后图片放入同一个文件夹就可以按照当前文件夹里面的相对目录直接引用了。
这里我参考了文件管理方案，里面写的很详细，我就不再赘述。
4. 利用Mathjax加入Latex写公式 专业原因经常要写很多公式，当然也可以截图用图片引用，但是还是latex比较方便。
懒点的做法就是直接下载个支持latex的主题。但是支持latex又是你喜欢的主题有时候这两个条件并不能同时成立。也没关系，可以自己改下主题。
我的解决方案是参考了这里
首先在你喜欢的主题下载好之后，在主题文件夹里面的layouts/partials里面创建一个mathjax.html文件，比如我的目录就是：
myblog/themes/hugo-theme-techdoc/layouts/partials
文件里面写入：
&lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot; async src=&quot;https://cdn.bootcss.com/mathjax/2.7.3/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML&quot;&gt; MathJax.Hub.Config({ tex2jax: { inlineMath: [['$','$'], …
title: 1. Hugo搭建博客+引入mathjax+部署GitHub page
